definition: Wang Qishan (1948-), PRC politician
surname Wang
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to rule/to reign over
variant of 歧[qi2]
surname Qi/also used in place names
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Geithner flew to Beijing to meet Wang at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 盖特纳便飞往北京在机场与王岐山会面。

sentences.english: China's vice premier Wang Qishan started up the service.
sentences.chinese: 中国副总理王岐山启动了服务仪式。

sentences.english: I want to thank State CouncilorDai and Vice-Premier Wang for their very warm hospitality.
sentences.chinese: 感谢国务委员戴秉国和副总理王岐山非常热情的接待。

sentences.english: Wang hailed the commitment of Kansai to promoting Sino-Japanese friendship and exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 王岐山对关西地区长期致力于中日友好往来表示赞赏。

sentences.english: Wang first of all extended congratulations on the success of the dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 王岐山首先对中美省州长对话的成功举行表示祝贺。

definition: Zhao Leji (1957-), member of the Politburo Standing Committee and Secretary of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection
Liu Yunshan (1947-), PRC politician, background in journalism in Inner Mongolia, head of the Central Propaganda Department 2002-2012
Zhang Gaoli (1946-), PRC politician
Hu Jintao (1942-), General Secretary of the CCP 2002-2012, president of the PRC 2003-2013
Bo Xilai (1949-), PRC politician, appointed to the Politburo in 2007, sentenced in 2013 to life imprisonment for corruption and misconduct
Xi Jinping (1953-), PRC politician, General Secretary of the CCP from 2012, president of the PRC from 2013
general secretary (of the Communist Party)
Zhang Dejiang (1946-), PRC politician
Yu Zhengsheng (1945-), PRC politician
Li Keqiang (1955-), PRC politician, prime minister from 2013
Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (CCDI), organization within the CCP which investigates corruption and other wrongdoing among Party cadres/abbr. for 中共中央紀律檢查委員會|中共中央纪律检查委员会
Jiang Zemin (1926-), politician, president of PRC 1993-2003
Zhu Rongji (1928-), PRC politician, premier 1998-2003
Zhou Yongkang (1942-), PRC petroleum engineer and politician
Jia Qinglin (1940-), member of the Politburo Standing Committee 2002-2012
Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, abbr. for 中國共產黨中央委員會|中国共产党中央委员会[Zhong1 guo2 Gong4 chan3 dang3 Zhong1 yang1 Wei3 yuan2 hui4]
